entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY IN EFFECT THROUGH 10:00 A.M. TUESDAY

Forecasters at the National Weather Service said poor air quality will continue. This is due to an inversion and stagnant air conditions near the surface that will continue to trap pollutants. entry.title: DCSO ISSUES SCAM ALERT
entry.summary: January 20, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office has issued a scam alert. A release said scammers continue to impersonate local law enforcement, including those from DCSO, to extract money from victims. Many residents have recently reported fictitious phone calls from unknown callers claiming to be from law enforcement. Often these callers will...

entry.title: WORKSHOP FOR PEOPLE INTERESTED IN BEEKEEPING

entry.title: Oregon Pair Arrested for Posing as Firefighters During Palisades Fire Emergency
entry.summary: Two Oregon residents were arrested Saturday in Los Angeles County after allegedly impersonating firefighters and attempting to enter an evacuation zone during the active Palisades Fire. Dustin Nehl, 31, and Jennifer Nehl, 44, were discovered operating a fire truck purchased at auction while wearing firefighter turnout gear and CAL-Fire t-shirts.

entry.title: FREEZING FOG ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 A.M. SUNDAY
entry.summary: January 19, 2024 6:50 a.m. A Freezing Fog Advisory is in effect through 10:00 a.m. Sunday for much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said visibility of one quarter mile or less in freezing fog is expected. The Advisory area includes central Douglas County, Josephine and Jackson counties and eastern Curry County....

entry.title: Tragic Logging Accident Claims Life Near Azalea
entry.summary: Justin Godel, a 49-year-old Winston resident, lost his life Thursday afternoon in a logging accident. The incident occurred while Godel was working for Dancer Logging at a site on Upper Cow Creek Road near Azalea, Oregon. Emergency services were alerted to the serious injury at approximately 3:20 p.m.
